intro: Kennedia carinata var. subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Kennedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves and showy, bright red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal regions and can thrive in full sun, making it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
